categories.name: ScottPlot 5 Quickstart
categories.description: A survey of basic functionality in ScottPlot 5

categories.name: Bar Plot
categories.description: Bar plots represent values as horizontal or vertical rectangles

categories.name: Box Plot
categories.description: Box plots show a distribution at a glance

categories.name: Error Bars
categories.description: Error Bars communicate the range of possible values for a measurement

categories.name: FillY plot
categories.description: FillY plots display the vertical range between two Y values at defined X positions

categories.name: Financial Plot
categories.description: Finance plots display price data binned into time ranges

categories.name: Function
categories.description: Function plots are a type of line plot where Y positions are defined by a function that depends on X rather than a collection of discrete data points.

categories.name: Heatmap
categories.description: Heatmaps display values from 2D data as an image with cells of different intensities

categories.name: Line Plot
categories.description: Line plots can be placed on the plot in coordinate space using a Start, End, and an optional LineStyle.

categories.name: Marker
categories.description: Markers can be placed on the plot in coordinate space.

categories.name: Polygon Plot
categories.description: Polygon plots draws a polygon

categories.name: Scatter Plot
categories.description: Scatter plots display points at X/Y locations in coordinate space.

categories.name: Signal Plot
categories.description: Signal plots display evenly-spaced data

categories.name: Text
categories.description: Text lables placed on the plot in coordinate space

categories.name: Regression
categories.description: Statistical operations to fit lines to data

categories.name: Axis and Ticks
categories.description: Examples of common customizations for axis labels and ticks

categories.name: Configuring Legends
categories.description: A legend is a key typically displayed in the corner of a plot

categories.name: Styling Plots
categories.description: How to customize plots

categories.name: Customizing Grids
categories.description: Advanced customization of grid lines

categories.name: Customizing Ticks
categories.description: Advanced customization of tick marks and tick labels

categories.name: DateTime Axes
categories.description: Plot data values on a DataTime axes

categories.name: Advanced Axis Features
categories.description: Tick mark customization and creation of multi-Axis plots

recipes.name: Hide Grid
recipes.description: Grid lines can be hidden.

recipes.name: Grid Customization
recipes.description: Grid lines can be customized. Custom grid systems can be created to give developers full control of grid rendering, but the default grid can be interacted with to customize its appearance.

recipes.name: Grid Above Data
recipes.description: Grid lines are typically drawn beneath data, but grids can be configured to render on top of plottables too.

recipes.name: Custom Tick Formatters
recipes.description: Users can customize the logic used to create tick labels from tick positions.

recipes.name: Custom Tick Generators
recipes.description: Tick generators determine where ticks are to be placed and also contain logic for generating tick labels from tick positions. Alternative tick generators can be created and assigned to axes. Some common tick generators are provided with ScottPlot, and users also have the option create their own.

recipes.name: Custom Tick Positions
recipes.description: Users can define ticks to be placed at specific locations.

recipes.name: DateTime Axis Quickstart
recipes.description: Axis tick labels can be displayed using a time format.

recipes.name: Right Axis
recipes.description: New plots have one axis on every side. Axes on the right and top are invisible by default. To use the right axis, make it visible, then tell a plottable to use it.

recipes.name: Multi-Axis
recipes.description: Additional axes may be added to plots. Plottables are displayed using the coordinate system of the primary axes by default, but any plottable can be displayed using any X and Y axis.

recipes.name: Adding Axis Labels
recipes.description: Axis labels are the text labels centered on each axis. The text inside these labels can be changed, and the style of the text can be extensively customized.

recipes.name: Manually Set Axis Limits
recipes.description: Axis Limits can be set manually in different ways.

recipes.name: Read Axis Limits
recipes.description: The current axis limits can be read in multiple ways.

recipes.name: AutoScale Axis Limits to Fit Data
recipes.description: The axis limits can be automatically adjusted to fit the data. Optional arguments allow users to define the amount of whitespace around the edges of the data.In older versions of ScottPlot this functionality was achieved by a method named AxisAuto().

recipes.name: Frameless Plot
recipes.description: How to create a plot containig only the data area and no axes.

recipes.name: Legend Customization
recipes.description: The default legend can be easily accessed and customized. It is possible to add multiple legends, including custom ones implementing ILegend.

recipes.name: Manual Legend
recipes.description: Legends may be constructed manually.

recipes.name: Style Helper Functions
recipes.description: Plots contain many objects which can be customized individually by assigining to their public properties, but helper methods exist in the Plot's Style object that make it easier to customzie many items at once using a simpler API.

recipes.name: Axis Customization
recipes.description: Axis labels, tick marks, and frame can all be customized.

recipes.name: Palettes
recipes.description: A palette is a set of colors, and the Plot's palette defines the default colors to use when adding new plottables. ScottPlot comes with many standard palettes, but users may also create their own.

recipes.name: Markers
recipes.description: Many plot types have a MarkerStyle which can be customized.

recipes.name: Marker Names
recipes.description: Markers can be referred to by their name.

recipes.name: Line Styles
recipes.description: Many plot types have a LineStyle which can be customized.

recipes.name: Scaling
recipes.description: All components of an image can be scaled up or down in size by adjusting the ScaleFactor property. This is very useful for creating images that look nice on high DPI displays with display scaling enabled.

recipes.name: Bar Plot Quickstart
recipes.description: Bar plots can be added from a series of values.

recipes.name: Bar Positioning
recipes.description: The exact position and size of each bar may be customized.

recipes.name: Bars with Error
recipes.description: Bars can have errorbars.

recipes.name: Bars with Labeled Ticks
recipes.description: Bars can be labeled by manually specifying axis tick mark positions and labels.

recipes.name: Stacked Bar Plot
recipes.description: Bars can be positioned on top of each other.

recipes.name: Grouped Bar Plot
recipes.description: Bars can be grouped by position and color.

recipes.name: Box Plot Quickstart
recipes.description: Box plots can be created individually and added to the plot.

recipes.name: Box Plot Groups
recipes.description: Each collection of boxes added to the plot gets styled the same and appears as a single item in the legend. Add multiple bar series plots with defined X positions to give the appearance of grouped data.

recipes.name: Error Bar Quickstart
recipes.description: Error Bars go well with scatter plots.

recipes.name: ErrorBar Values
recipes.description: Error size can be set for all dimensions.

recipes.name: FillY From Array Data
recipes.description: FillY plots can be created from X, Y1, and Y2 arrays.

recipes.name: FillY From Scatter Plots
recipes.description: FillY plots can be created from two scatter plots that share the same X values.

recipes.name: FillY with Custom Type
recipes.description: FillY plots can be created from data of any type if a conversion function is supplied.

recipes.name: FillY Plot Styling
recipes.description: FillY plots can be customized using public properties.

recipes.name: OHLC Chart
recipes.description: OHLC charts use symbols to display price data (open, high, low, and close) for specific time ranges.

recipes.name: Candlestick Chart
recipes.description: Candlestick charts use symbols to display price data. The rectangle indicates open and close prices, and the center line indicates minimum and maximum price for the given time period. Color indicates whether the price increased or decreased between open and close.

recipes.name: Simple Moving Average
recipes.description: Tools exist for creating simple moving average (SMA) curves and displaying them next to finanial data.

recipes.name: Bollinger Bands
recipes.description: Tools exist for creating Bollinger Bands which display weighted moving mean and variance for time series financial data.

recipes.name: Function Quickstart
recipes.description: Create a function plot from a formula.

recipes.name: Heatmap Quickstart
recipes.description: Heatmaps can be created from 2D arrays

recipes.name: Inverted Heatmap
recipes.description: Heatmaps can be inverted by reversing the order of colors in the colormap

recipes.name: Line Plot Quickstart
recipes.description: Line plots are placed with a start and end location in coordinate space. Their styles can be customized.

recipes.name: Line Plot Shapes
recipes.description: Line plots can be styled using a LineStyle.

recipes.name: Line Plot Legend
recipes.description: Line plots with labels appear in the legend.

recipes.name: Marker Quickstart
recipes.description: Markers are symbols placed at a location in coordinate space. Their shape, size, and color can be customized.

recipes.name: Marker Shapes
recipes.description: Many marker shapes are available.

recipes.name: Marker Legend
recipes.description: Markers with labels appear in the legend.

recipes.name: Polygon Plot Quickstart
recipes.description: Polygon plots can be added from a series of vertices, and must be in clockwise order.

recipes.name: Polygon Plot Styling
recipes.description: Polygon plots can be fully customized.

recipes.name: Scatter Plot Quickstart
recipes.description: Scatter plots can be created from two arrays containing X and Y values.

recipes.name: Scatter Plot Coordinates
recipes.description: Scatter plots can be created from a collection of Coordinates.

recipes.name: Scatter Plot Data Type
recipes.description: Scatter plots can be created from any numeric data type, not just double.

recipes.name: Scatter Plot of List Data
recipes.description: Scatter plots can be created from Lists, but be very cafeful not to add or remove items while a render is occurring or you may throw an index exception. See documentation about the Render Lock system for details.

recipes.name: Scatter Plot Styling
recipes.description: Scatter plots can be extensively styled by interacting with the object that is returned after a scatter plot is added. Assign text to a scatter plot's Label property to allow it to appear in the legend.

recipes.name: Scatter Line Patterns
recipes.description: Several line patterns are available

recipes.name: Signal Plot Quickstart
recipes.description: Signal plots are best for extremely large datasets. They use render using special optimizations that allow highspeed interactivity with plots containing millions of data points.

recipes.name: Signal Plot Styling
recipes.description: Signal plots can be styled in a variety of ways.

recipes.name: Signal Offset
recipes.description: Signal plots can be offset by a given X and Y value.

recipes.name: Signal Marker Size
recipes.description: Signal plots can have markers displayed at each point which are only visible when the plot is zoomed in.

recipes.name: Partial Signal Rendering
recipes.description: Even if a signal plot references a large array of data, rendering can be limited to a range of values. If set,only the range of data between the minimum and maximum render indexes will be displayed.

recipes.name: Text Quickstart
recipes.description: Text can be placed anywhere in coordinate space.

recipes.name: Text Formatting
recipes.description: Text formatting can be extensively customized.

recipes.name: Scatter Plot
recipes.description: Display paired X/Y data as a scatter plot.

recipes.name: Customizing Plottables
recipes.description: Functions that add things to plots return the plottables they create. Interact with the properties of plottables to customize their styling and behavior.

recipes.name: Signal Plot
recipes.description: Signal plots are optimized for displaying evenly spaced data.

recipes.name: Signal Plot Performance
recipes.description: Signal plots can interactively display millions of data points in real time. Double-click the plot to display performance benchmarks.

recipes.name: Axis Labels
recipes.description: Axis labels can be extensively customized.

recipes.name: Legend
recipes.description: A legend displays plottables in a key along the edge of a plot. Most plottables have a Label property which configures what text appears in the legend.

recipes.name: LinearRegression
recipes.description: Fit a line to a collection of X/Y data points.
